docs.snippet: Àlex Ollé brings an avant-garde sensibility to “The Flying Dutchman,” which he set in Bangladesh instead of Norway. The production opens in Madrid on Saturday.

docs.snippet: In a call with investors, the chiefs of the companies noted that the combined trove of their consumer data would be useful to marketers and consumers.

headline.print_headline: After Merger, TV Ads for an Audience of One?
headline.main: Individualized Ads on TV Could Be One Result of AT&T-Time Warner Merger

docs.abstract: Time Warner chief exec Jeffrey L Bewkes, during call to investors, asserts that one potential benefit of AT&T and Time Warner's proposed merger could be introduction of addressable television advertising, in which people are targeted with individualized TV commercials using cable or satellite boxes; notes combined companies' vast trove of consumer data could be useful for marketers and consumers.
